controllers.factory.smc_factoryÂ¶

Source: src\controllers\factory\smc_factory.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Clean SMC Controller Factory - Focused on 4 Core SMC Controllers

Provides a unified, type-safe interface for creating SMC controllers optimized for:

  • PSO parameter tuning

  • Research consistency

  • Performance benchmarking

  • Clean separation of concerns

Design Principles:

  • Single responsibility: Only SMC controllers

  • Consistent interfaces: Unified parameter handling

  • PSO-ready: Array-based parameter injection

  • Type-safe: Explicit typing for all controllers

  • Minimal: No unnecessary complexity

Mathematical FoundationÂ¶

Factory Design PatternÂ¶

The Factory Pattern encapsulates object creation logic, providing loose coupling between client code and concrete implementations.

Gang of Four DefinitionÂ¶

Intent: Define an interface for creating objects, but let subclasses decide which class to instantiate.

\[\text{Factory}: \text{ProductType} \times \text{Parameters} \to \text{ConcreteProduct}\]

SMC Controller HierarchyÂ¶

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \text{SMC} &\to \text{Controller} \quad \text{(abstract base)} \\ &\to \text{ClassicalSMC} \\ &\to \text{AdaptiveSMC} \\ &\to \text{SuperTwistingSMC} \\ &\to \text{HybridAdaptiveSMC} \end{align}\end{split}\]

Enum-Based Type SafetyÂ¶

Type-safe controller selection:

class SMCType(Enum):
    CLASSICAL = "classical"
    ADAPTIVE = "adaptive"
    SUPER_TWISTING = "sta"
    HYBRID = "hybrid"

Compile-time validation: Python type checker (mypy) validates:

# example-metadata:
# runnable: false

def create_controller(ctrl_type: SMCType, ...) -> Controller:
    ...

Registry PatternÂ¶

Dynamic controller registration:

\[\text{Registry}: \text{SMCType} \to (\text{Parameters} \to \text{Controller})\]

Benefits:

  1. Open/Closed Principle: Add new controllers without modifying factory

  2. Plugin Architecture: Controllers can be registered at runtime

  3. Testing: Mock controllers can be injected

Singleton RegistryÂ¶

Single global registry avoids duplication:

_controller_registry: Dict[SMCType, Callable] = {}

def register_controller(ctrl_type: SMCType, factory_fn: Callable):
    _controller_registry[ctrl_type] = factory_fn

Thread safety: Use locks if multi-threaded:

_registry_lock = threading.Lock()

with _registry_lock:
    _controller_registry[ctrl_type] = factory_fn

Dependency InjectionÂ¶

Inversion of Control: Factory receives dependencies rather than creating them:

# example-metadata:
# runnable: false

def create_controller(
    ctrl_type: SMCType,
    gains: List[float],
    dynamics_model: Optional[DynamicsModel] = None,  # Injected
    config: Optional[Config] = None  # Injected
) -> Controller:
    ...

Benefits:

  • Testability: Inject mock dynamics models

  • Flexibility: Change models without factory changes

  • Loose coupling: Factory doesnâ€™t depend on concrete dynamics

Gain Specification PatternÂ¶

Each controller type specifies gain requirements:

\[\text{GainSpec} = (n_{gains}, \text{bounds}, \text{names})\]

Example:

@dataclass
class GainSpecification:
    n_gains: int
    bounds: List[Tuple[float, float]]
    gain_names: List[str]
    description: str

Runtime validation:

def validate_gains(ctrl_type: SMCType, gains: List[float]) -> bool:
    spec = get_gain_specification(ctrl_type)
    if len(gains) != spec.n_gains:
        return False
    return all(lb <= g <= ub for g, (lb, ub) in zip(gains, spec.bounds))

Configuration Dataclass PatternÂ¶

Type-safe configuration:

# example-metadata:
# runnable: false

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class SMCConfig:
    gains: List[float]
    max_force: float
    dt: float
    boundary_layer: float = 0.01

    def __post_init__(self):
        # Validation logic
        if self.max_force <= 0:
            raise ValueError("max_force must be positive")

Benefits:

  • Immutable (frozen=True)

  • Type hints enforced

  • Validation in __post_init__

  • Auto-generated __repr__ and __eq__

Builder Pattern VariantÂ¶

For complex configurations:

# example-metadata:
# runnable: false

class SMCConfigBuilder:
    def __init__(self):
        self._config = {}

    def with_gains(self, gains: List[float]):
        self._config['gains'] = gains
        return self

    def with_max_force(self, max_force: float):
        self._config['max_force'] = max_force
        return self

    def build(self) -> SMCConfig:
        return SMCConfig(**self._config)

Usage:

config = (SMCConfigBuilder()
    .with_gains([10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5])
    .with_max_force(100.0)
    .build())

Performance ConsiderationsÂ¶

Factory overhead:

  • Type dispatch: \(O(1)\) hash table lookup

  • Object construction: \(O(n_{params})\)

  • Validation: \(O(n_{gains})\)

Total: Negligible compared to controller compute time (~\(\mu\)s vs ms).

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

graph TD A[Client Request: SMCType, gains, config] --> B[Factory.create_controller] B --> C{Validate Gains} C -->|Invalid| D[Raise ValueError] C -->|Valid| E{Type Dispatch} E -->|CLASSICAL| F[ClassicalSMC.__init__] E -->|ADAPTIVE| G[AdaptiveSMC.__init__] E -->|SUPER_TWISTING| H[SuperTwistingSMC.__init__] E -->|HYBRID| I[HybridAdaptiveSMC.__init__] F --> J[Return Controller Instance] G --> J H --> J I --> J J --> K[Client Uses: controller.compute_control] style B fill:#9cf style E fill:#ff9 style J fill:#9f9 style D fill:#f99

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Basic Controller CreationÂ¶

from src.controllers.factory import SMCType, create_controller

# Create classical SMC controller
controller = create_controller(
    ctrl_type=SMCType.CLASSICAL,
    gains=[10.0, 8.0, 15.0, 12.0, 50.0, 0.01],
    max_force=100.0,
    dt=0.01
)

# Use controller
state = np.array([0.1, 0.0, 0.05, 0.1, 0.02, 0.05])
u, state_vars, history = controller.compute_control(state, {}, {})
print(f"Control output: {u:.2f} N")

Example 2: Type-Safe Factory UsageÂ¶

from src.controllers.factory import SMCFactory, SMCConfig

# Create configuration dataclass
config = SMCConfig(
    gains=[10.0, 8.0, 15.0, 12.0, 50.0, 0.01],
    max_force=100.0,
    dt=0.01,
    boundary_layer=0.01
)

# Factory ensures type safety
controller = SMCFactory.create_controller(SMCType.CLASSICAL, config)

# mypy validates this at compile time!

Example 3: Gain Specification QueryÂ¶

from src.controllers.factory import SMCFactory, SMCType

# Get gain requirements for each controller type
for ctrl_type in SMCType:
    spec = SMCFactory.get_gain_specification(ctrl_type)
    print(f"\n{ctrl_type.value}:")
    print(f"  Number of gains: {spec.n_gains}")
    print(f"  Gain names:      {spec.gain_names}")
    print(f"  Bounds:          {spec.bounds}")

Example 4: Dynamic Controller RegistryÂ¶

from src.controllers.factory.core.registry import ControllerRegistry

# View registered controllers
registry = ControllerRegistry()
registered_types = registry.list_controllers()

print("Registered Controllers:")
for ctrl_type in registered_types:
    factory_fn = registry.get_factory(ctrl_type)
    print(f"  {ctrl_type.value}: {factory_fn.__name__}")

# Register custom controller (plugin architecture)
def create_custom_smc(config):
    return CustomSMC(**config)

registry.register(SMCType.CUSTOM, create_custom_smc)

Example 5: Batch Controller CreationÂ¶

from src.controllers.factory import create_all_smc_controllers

# Gains for each controller type
gains_dict = {
    "classical": [10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 0.01],
    "adaptive": [10, 8, 15, 12, 0.5],
    "sta": [25, 10, 15, 12, 20, 15],
    "hybrid": [15, 12, 18, 15]
}

# Create all controllers for comparison
controllers = create_all_smc_controllers(
    gains_dict,
    max_force=100.0,
    dt=0.01
)

# Simulate each controller
results = {}
for ctrl_name, controller in controllers.items():
    result = simulate(controller, duration=5.0)
    results[ctrl_name] = result
    print(f"{ctrl_name}: ITAE={result.itae:.3f}")

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#======================= src/controllers/factory/smc_factory.py =======================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Clean SMC Controller Factory - Focused on 4 Core SMC Controllers
  7
  8Provides a unified, type-safe interface for creating SMC controllers optimized for:
  9- PSO parameter tuning
 10- Research consistency
 11- Performance benchmarking
 12- Clean separation of concerns
 13
 14Design Principles:
 15- Single responsibility: Only SMC controllers
 16- Consistent interfaces: Unified parameter handling
 17- PSO-ready: Array-based parameter injection
 18- Type-safe: Explicit typing for all controllers
 19- Minimal: No unnecessary complexity
 20"""
 21
 22# Standard library imports
 23from __future__ import annotations
 24from dataclasses import dataclass
 25from enum import Enum
 26from typing import Protocol, Union, List, Optional, Dict, Any
 27
 28# Third-party imports
 29import numpy as np
 30
 31# Import the 4 core SMC controllers
 32try:
 33    from .smc.classic_smc import ClassicalSMC
 34    from .smc.adaptive_smc import AdaptiveSMC
 35    from .smc.sta_smc import SuperTwistingSMC
 36    from .smc.hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc import HybridAdaptiveSTASMC
 37except ImportError:
 38    # Fallback for different import contexts
 39    try:
 40        from src.controllers.smc.classic_smc import ClassicalSMC
 41        from src.controllers.smc.adaptive_smc import AdaptiveSMC
 42        from src.controllers.smc.sta_smc import SuperTwistingSMC
 43        from src.controllers.smc.hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc import HybridAdaptiveSTASMC
 44    except ImportError:
 45        # Final fallback - define dummy classes for demo
 46        class ClassicalSMC:
 47            def __init__(self, **kwargs: Any) -> None:
 48                self.gains = kwargs.get('gains', [])
 49        class AdaptiveSMC:
 50            def __init__(self, **kwargs: Any) -> None:
 51                self.gains = kwargs.get('gains', [])
 52        class SuperTwistingSMC:
 53            def __init__(self, **kwargs: Any) -> None:
 54                self.gains = kwargs.get('gains', [])
 55        class HybridAdaptiveSTASMC:
 56            def __init__(self, **kwargs: Any) -> None:
 57                self.gains = kwargs.get('gains', [])
 58
 59# ============================================================================
 60# SMC CONTROLLER TYPES AND PROTOCOLS
 61# ============================================================================
 62
 63class SMCType(Enum):
 64    """Enumeration of the 4 core SMC controller types."""
 65    CLASSICAL = "classical_smc"
 66    ADAPTIVE = "adaptive_smc"
 67    SUPER_TWISTING = "sta_smc"
 68    HYBRID = "hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc"
 69
 70class SMCProtocol(Protocol):
 71    """Protocol defining the unified SMC controller interface."""
 72
 73    def compute_control(self, state: np.ndarray, state_vars: Any, history: Dict[str, Any]) -> Any:
 74        """Compute control input for given state."""
 75        ...
 76
 77    def initialize_state(self) -> Any:
 78        """Initialize controller internal state."""
 79        ...
 80
 81    def initialize_history(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 82        """Initialize controller history tracking."""
 83        ...
 84
 85    @property
 86    def gains(self) -> List[float]:
 87        """Return controller gains."""
 88        ...
 89
 90
 91class PSOControllerWrapper:
 92    """PSO-friendly wrapper that simplifies the control interface."""
 93
 94    def __init__(self, controller: SMCProtocol):
 95        self.controller = controller
 96        self._history = {}     # Empty dict as default
 97
 98        # Initialize appropriate state_vars based on controller type
 99        controller_name = type(controller).__name__
100        if 'SuperTwisting' in controller_name or 'STA' in controller_name:
101            # STA-SMC expects (z, sigma) tuple
102            self._state_vars = (0.0, 0.0)  # Initial (z=0, sigma=0)
103        elif 'Hybrid' in controller_name:
104            # Hybrid controller expects (k1_prev, k2_prev, u_int_prev) tuple
105            self._state_vars = (self.controller.k1_init, self.controller.k2_init, 0.0)
106        else:
107            # Classical and Adaptive SMC typically use empty tuple
108            self._state_vars = ()
109
110    def compute_control(self, state: np.ndarray, state_vars: Optional[Any] = None, history: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None) -> Union[np.ndarray, Any]:
111        """
112        Flexible compute_control interface supporting both patterns:
113        1. compute_control(state) - PSO-friendly simplified interface
114        2. compute_control(state, state_vars, history) - Full interface
115        """
116        # Use provided parameters or defaults
117        final_state_vars = state_vars if state_vars is not None else self._state_vars
118        final_history = history if history is not None else self._history
119
120        result = self.controller.compute_control(state, final_state_vars, final_history)
121
122        # For simplified interface (PSO usage), return numpy array
123        if state_vars is None and history is None:
124            # Extract control value from result - handle different output types
125            if hasattr(result, 'u'):
126                control_value = result.u
127            elif hasattr(result, 'control'):
128                control_value = result.control
129            elif isinstance(result, dict) and 'u' in result:
130                control_value = result['u']
131            elif isinstance(result, dict) and 'control' in result:
132                control_value = result['control']
133            elif isinstance(result, tuple) and len(result) > 0:
134                # Handle tuple returns (like early return from Hybrid controller)
135                control_value = result[0]  # First element should be control value
136            else:
137                # Fallback: assume result is the control value
138                control_value = result
139
140            # Ensure numpy array output
141            if isinstance(control_value, (int, float)):
142                return np.array([control_value])
143            elif isinstance(control_value, np.ndarray):
144                return control_value.flatten()
145            else:
146                return np.array([float(control_value)])
147        else:
148            # For full interface, return original result
149            return result
150
151    @property
152    def gains(self) -> List[float]:
153        """Return controller gains."""
154        return self.controller.gains
155
156# ============================================================================
157# CLEAN PARAMETER CONFIGURATION
158# ============================================================================
159
160@dataclass(frozen=True)
161class SMCConfig:
162    """Clean configuration for all SMC controllers."""
163
164    # Core parameters (common to all SMCs)
165    gains: List[float]
166    max_force: float = 100.0
167    dt: float = 0.01
168
169    # Optional dynamics model
170    dynamics_model: Optional[Any] = None
171
172    # Controller-specific parameters (use defaults if not specified)
173    boundary_layer: float = 0.01
174    damping_gain: float = 0.0
175
176    # Adaptive SMC specific
177    leak_rate: float = 0.1
178    adapt_rate_limit: float = 100.0
179    K_min: float = 0.1
180    K_max: float = 100.0
181    K_init: float = 10.0
182    dead_zone: float = 0.01
183    smooth_switch: bool = True
184    alpha: float = 0.5
185
186    # Hybrid SMC specific
187    k1_init: float = 5.0
188    k2_init: float = 3.0
189    gamma1: float = 0.5
190    gamma2: float = 0.3
191
192    def __post_init__(self) -> None:
193        """Validate SMC configuration parameters."""
194        if not self.gains or len(self.gains) == 0:
195            raise ValueError("SMC gains cannot be empty")
196
197        if self.max_force <= 0:
198            raise ValueError("max_force must be positive")
199
200        if self.dt <= 0:
201            raise ValueError("dt must be positive")
202
203        if self.boundary_layer <= 0:
204            raise ValueError("boundary_layer must be positive")
205
206        # Validate gain positivity (SMC stability requirement)
207        if any(g <= 0 for g in self.gains[:4]):  # First 4 gains are typically surface gains
208            raise ValueError("SMC surface gains must be positive for stability")
209
210# ============================================================================
211# GAIN SPECIFICATIONS FOR PSO
212# ============================================================================
213
214@dataclass(frozen=True)
215class SMCGainSpec:
216    """Specification of gain requirements for each SMC type."""
217    controller_type: SMCType
218    n_gains: int
219    gain_names: List[str]
220    description: str
221
222    @property
223    def gain_bounds(self) -> List[tuple[float, float]]:
224        """Default gain bounds for PSO optimization."""
225        if self.controller_type == SMCType.CLASSICAL:
226            # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, K, kd]
227            return [(0.1, 50.0)] * 4 + [(1.0, 200.0)] + [(0.0, 50.0)]
228        elif self.controller_type == SMCType.ADAPTIVE:
229            # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, gamma]
230            return [(0.1, 50.0)] * 4 + [(0.01, 10.0)]
231        elif self.controller_type == SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING:
232            # [K1, K2, k1, k2, lam1, lam2]
233            return [(1.0, 100.0)] * 2 + [(0.1, 50.0)] * 4
234        elif self.controller_type == SMCType.HYBRID:
235            # [c1, lambda1, c2, lambda2]
236            return [(0.1, 50.0)] * 4
237        else:
238            raise ValueError(f"Unknown SMC type: {self.controller_type}")
239
240# Pre-defined gain specifications
241SMC_GAIN_SPECS: Dict[SMCType, SMCGainSpec] = {
242    SMCType.CLASSICAL: SMCGainSpec(
243        SMCType.CLASSICAL, 6,
244        ["k1", "k2", "lam1", "lam2", "K", "kd"],
245        "Classical SMC with switching and damping gains"
246    ),
247    SMCType.ADAPTIVE: SMCGainSpec(
248        SMCType.ADAPTIVE, 5,
249        ["k1", "k2", "lam1", "lam2", "gamma"],
250        "Adaptive SMC with online gain adaptation"
251    ),
252    SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING: SMCGainSpec(
253        SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING, 6,
254        ["K1", "K2", "k1", "k2", "lam1", "lam2"],
255        "Super-twisting algorithm with 2nd order sliding"
256    ),
257    SMCType.HYBRID: SMCGainSpec(
258        SMCType.HYBRID, 4,
259        ["c1", "lambda1", "c2", "lambda2"],
260        "Hybrid adaptive super-twisting controller"
261    )
262}
263
264# ============================================================================
265# CLEAN SMC FACTORY
266# ============================================================================
267
268class SMCFactory:
269    """
270    Clean, focused factory for creating SMC controllers.
271
272    Optimized for:
273    - PSO parameter optimization
274    - Research benchmarking
275    - Type safety and consistency
276    """
277
278    @staticmethod
279    def create_controller(
280        smc_type: Union[SMCType, str],
281        config: SMCConfig
282    ) -> SMCProtocol:
283        """
284        Create an SMC controller with clean, validated configuration.
285
286        Args:
287            smc_type: Type of SMC controller to create
288            config: Validated SMC configuration
289
290        Returns:
291            Initialized SMC controller
292
293        Raises:
294            ValueError: If controller type is invalid or configuration is invalid
295        """
296        # Normalize SMC type
297        if isinstance(smc_type, str):
298            try:
299                smc_type = SMCType(smc_type.lower().replace("-", "_"))
300            except ValueError:
301                raise ValueError(f"Invalid SMC type: {smc_type}")
302
303        # Validate gains for this controller type
304        spec = SMC_GAIN_SPECS[smc_type]
305        if len(config.gains) < spec.n_gains:
306            raise ValueError(
307                f"{smc_type.value} requires at least {spec.n_gains} gains, got {len(config.gains)}"
308            )
309
310        # Create controller based on type
311        if smc_type == SMCType.CLASSICAL:
312            return SMCFactory._create_classical_smc(config)
313        elif smc_type == SMCType.ADAPTIVE:
314            return SMCFactory._create_adaptive_smc(config)
315        elif smc_type == SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING:
316            return SMCFactory._create_super_twisting_smc(config)
317        elif smc_type == SMCType.HYBRID:
318            return SMCFactory._create_hybrid_smc(config)
319        else:
320            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported SMC type: {smc_type}")
321
322    @staticmethod
323    def create_from_gains(
324        smc_type: Union[SMCType, str],
325        gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
326        **kwargs: Any
327    ) -> SMCProtocol:
328        """
329        PSO-friendly: Create controller directly from gains array.
330
331        Args:
332            smc_type: Type of SMC controller
333            gains: Gain values as list or array
334            **kwargs: Additional configuration parameters
335
336        Returns:
337            Initialized SMC controller
338        """
339        # Convert gains to list
340        gains_list = list(np.asarray(gains).flatten())
341
342        # Create configuration with gains and defaults
343        config = SMCConfig(gains=gains_list, **kwargs)
344
345        return SMCFactory.create_controller(smc_type, config)
346
347    @staticmethod
348    def get_gain_specification(smc_type: Union[SMCType, str]) -> SMCGainSpec:
349        """Get gain specification for an SMC controller type."""
350        if isinstance(smc_type, str):
351            smc_type = SMCType(smc_type.lower().replace("-", "_"))
352        return SMC_GAIN_SPECS[smc_type]
353
354    @staticmethod
355    def list_available_controllers() -> List[SMCType]:
356        """List all available SMC controller types."""
357        return list(SMCType)
358
359    # ========================================================================
360    # PRIVATE CONTROLLER CREATION METHODS
361    # ========================================================================
362
363    @staticmethod
364    def _create_classical_smc(config: SMCConfig) -> ClassicalSMC:
365        """Create Classical SMC with clean parameter mapping."""
366        return ClassicalSMC(
367            gains=config.gains,
368            max_force=config.max_force,
369            boundary_layer=config.boundary_layer,
370            dynamics_model=config.dynamics_model
371        )
372
373    @staticmethod
374    def _create_adaptive_smc(config: SMCConfig) -> AdaptiveSMC:
375        """Create Adaptive SMC with clean parameter mapping."""
376        return AdaptiveSMC(
377            gains=config.gains,
378            dt=config.dt,
379            max_force=config.max_force,
380            leak_rate=config.leak_rate,
381            adapt_rate_limit=config.adapt_rate_limit,
382            K_min=config.K_min,
383            K_max=config.K_max,
384            smooth_switch=config.smooth_switch,
385            boundary_layer=config.boundary_layer,
386            dead_zone=config.dead_zone,
387            K_init=config.K_init,
388            alpha=config.alpha
389        )
390
391    @staticmethod
392    def _create_super_twisting_smc(config: SMCConfig) -> SuperTwistingSMC:
393        """Create Super-Twisting SMC with clean parameter mapping."""
394        return SuperTwistingSMC(
395            gains=config.gains,
396            dt=config.dt,
397            max_force=config.max_force,
398            damping_gain=config.damping_gain,
399            boundary_layer=config.boundary_layer,
400            dynamics_model=config.dynamics_model
401        )
402
403    @staticmethod
404    def _create_hybrid_smc(config: SMCConfig) -> HybridAdaptiveSTASMC:
405        """Create Hybrid Adaptive-STA SMC with clean parameter mapping."""
406        return HybridAdaptiveSTASMC(
407            gains=config.gains,
408            dt=config.dt,
409            max_force=config.max_force,
410            k1_init=config.k1_init,
411            k2_init=config.k2_init,
412            gamma1=config.gamma1,
413            gamma2=config.gamma2,
414            dead_zone=config.dead_zone,
415            dynamics_model=config.dynamics_model
416        )
417
418# ============================================================================
419# CONVENIENCE FUNCTIONS FOR PSO INTEGRATION
420# ============================================================================
421
422def create_smc_for_pso(
423    smc_type: Union[SMCType, str],
424    gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
425    dynamics_model_or_max_force: Union[Any, float] = 100.0,
426    dt: float = 0.01,
427    dynamics_model: Optional[Any] = None
428) -> PSOControllerWrapper:
429    """
430    Convenience function optimized for PSO parameter tuning.
431
432    Supports both calling patterns:
433    1. create_smc_for_pso(smc_type, gains, max_force, dt, dynamics_model)
434    2. create_smc_for_pso(smc_type, gains, dynamics_model)
435
436    Usage:
437        # In PSO fitness function
438        controller = create_smc_for_pso("classical_smc", pso_params)
439        performance = evaluate_controller(controller, test_scenarios)
440        return performance
441    """
442    # Handle different calling patterns
443    if isinstance(dynamics_model_or_max_force, (int, float)):
444        # Pattern 1: max_force provided as third argument
445        max_force = float(dynamics_model_or_max_force)
446        final_dynamics_model = dynamics_model
447    else:
448        # Pattern 2: dynamics_model provided as third argument
449        max_force = 100.0  # Use default
450        final_dynamics_model = dynamics_model_or_max_force
451
452    controller = SMCFactory.create_from_gains(
453        smc_type=smc_type,
454        gains=gains,
455        max_force=max_force,
456        dt=dt,
457        dynamics_model=final_dynamics_model
458    )
459
460    # Wrap controller for PSO-friendly interface
461    wrapper = PSOControllerWrapper(controller)
462
463    # Add PSO-required attributes to the wrapper
464    spec = SMCFactory.get_gain_specification(smc_type)
465    wrapper.n_gains = spec.n_gains
466    wrapper.controller_type = smc_type.value if isinstance(smc_type, SMCType) else str(smc_type)
467
468    return wrapper
469
470def get_gain_bounds_for_pso(smc_type: Union[SMCType, str]) -> tuple[List[float], List[float]]:
471    """Get PSO optimization bounds for SMC controller gains."""
472    spec = SMCFactory.get_gain_specification(smc_type)
473    bounds = spec.gain_bounds
474
475    # Convert to PSO format: (lower_bounds, upper_bounds)
476    lower_bounds = [bound[0] for bound in bounds]
477    upper_bounds = [bound[1] for bound in bounds]
478
479    return (lower_bounds, upper_bounds)
480
481def validate_smc_gains(smc_type: Union[SMCType, str], gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray]) -> bool:
482    """Validate that gains are appropriate for the SMC controller type."""
483    try:
484        spec = SMCFactory.get_gain_specification(smc_type)
485        gains_array = np.asarray(gains)
486
487        # Check length
488        if len(gains_array) < spec.n_gains:
489            return False
490
491        # Check positivity for surface gains (SMC stability requirement)
492        if smc_type in [SMCType.CLASSICAL, SMCType.ADAPTIVE, SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING]:
493            if any(g <= 0 for g in gains_array[:4]):  # First 4 are typically surface gains
494                return False
495        elif smc_type == SMCType.HYBRID:
496            if any(g <= 0 for g in gains_array[:4]):  # All 4 gains must be positive
497                return False
498
499        return True
500    except Exception:
501        return False
502
503# ============================================================================
504# EXPORT CLEAN PUBLIC API
505# ============================================================================
506

508    # Core types

512    "SMCProtocol",
513
514    # Factory
515    "SMCFactory",
516
517    # PSO wrapper
518    "PSOControllerWrapper",
519
520    # PSO convenience functions
521    "create_smc_for_pso",
522    "get_gain_bounds_for_pso",
523    "validate_smc_gains",
524
525    # Specifications
526    "SMC_GAIN_SPECS"
527]

PSOControllerWrapperÂ¶

PSO-friendly wrapper that simplifies the control interface.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class PSOControllerWrapper:
 2    """PSO-friendly wrapper that simplifies the control interface."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, controller: SMCProtocol):
 5        self.controller = controller
 6        self._history = {}     # Empty dict as default
 7
 8        # Initialize appropriate state_vars based on controller type
 9        controller_name = type(controller).__name__
10        if 'SuperTwisting' in controller_name or 'STA' in controller_name:
11            # STA-SMC expects (z, sigma) tuple
12            self._state_vars = (0.0, 0.0)  # Initial (z=0, sigma=0)
13        elif 'Hybrid' in controller_name:
14            # Hybrid controller expects (k1_prev, k2_prev, u_int_prev) tuple
15            self._state_vars = (self.controller.k1_init, self.controller.k2_init, 0.0)
16        else:
17            # Classical and Adaptive SMC typically use empty tuple
18            self._state_vars = ()
19
20    def compute_control(self, state: np.ndarray, state_vars: Optional[Any] = None, history: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None) -> Union[np.ndarray, Any]:
21        """
22        Flexible compute_control interface supporting both patterns:
23        1. compute_control(state) - PSO-friendly simplified interface
24        2. compute_control(state, state_vars, history) - Full interface
25        """
26        # Use provided parameters or defaults
27        final_state_vars = state_vars if state_vars is not None else self._state_vars
28        final_history = history if history is not None else self._history
29
30        result = self.controller.compute_control(state, final_state_vars, final_history)
31
32        # For simplified interface (PSO usage), return numpy array
33        if state_vars is None and history is None:
34            # Extract control value from result - handle different output types
35            if hasattr(result, 'u'):
36                control_value = result.u
37            elif hasattr(result, 'control'):
38                control_value = result.control
39            elif isinstance(result, dict) and 'u' in result:
40                control_value = result['u']
41            elif isinstance(result, dict) and 'control' in result:
42                control_value = result['control']
43            elif isinstance(result, tuple) and len(result) > 0:
44                # Handle tuple returns (like early return from Hybrid controller)
45                control_value = result[0]  # First element should be control value
46            else:
47                # Fallback: assume result is the control value
48                control_value = result
49
50            # Ensure numpy array output
51            if isinstance(control_value, (int, float)):
52                return np.array([control_value])
53            elif isinstance(control_value, np.ndarray):
54                return control_value.flatten()
55            else:
56                return np.array([float(control_value)])
57        else:
58            # For full interface, return original result
59            return result
60
61    @property
62    def gains(self) -> List[float]:
63        """Return controller gains."""
64        return self.controller.gains

SMCConfigÂ¶

Clean configuration for all SMC controllers.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1@dataclass(frozen=True)
 2class SMCConfig:
 3    """Clean configuration for all SMC controllers."""
 4
 5    # Core parameters (common to all SMCs)
 6    gains: List[float]
 7    max_force: float = 100.0
 8    dt: float = 0.01
 9
10    # Optional dynamics model
11    dynamics_model: Optional[Any] = None
12
13    # Controller-specific parameters (use defaults if not specified)
14    boundary_layer: float = 0.01
15    damping_gain: float = 0.0
16
17    # Adaptive SMC specific
18    leak_rate: float = 0.1
19    adapt_rate_limit: float = 100.0
20    K_min: float = 0.1
21    K_max: float = 100.0
22    K_init: float = 10.0
23    dead_zone: float = 0.01
24    smooth_switch: bool = True
25    alpha: float = 0.5
26
27    # Hybrid SMC specific
28    k1_init: float = 5.0
29    k2_init: float = 3.0
30    gamma1: float = 0.5
31    gamma2: float = 0.3
32
33    def __post_init__(self) -> None:
34        """Validate SMC configuration parameters."""
35        if not self.gains or len(self.gains) == 0:
36            raise ValueError("SMC gains cannot be empty")
37
38        if self.max_force <= 0:
39            raise ValueError("max_force must be positive")
40
41        if self.dt <= 0:
42            raise ValueError("dt must be positive")
43
44        if self.boundary_layer <= 0:
45            raise ValueError("boundary_layer must be positive")
46
47        # Validate gain positivity (SMC stability requirement)
48        if any(g <= 0 for g in self.gains[:4]):  # First 4 gains are typically surface gains
49            raise ValueError("SMC surface gains must be positive for stability")

Methods (1)Â¶

__post_init__(self)Â¶

Validate SMC configuration parameters.

View full source â†’

 1@dataclass(frozen=True)
 2class SMCGainSpec:
 3    """Specification of gain requirements for each SMC type."""

 5    n_gains: int
 6    gain_names: List[str]
 7    description: str
 8
 9    @property
10    def gain_bounds(self) -> List[tuple[float, float]]:
11        """Default gain bounds for PSO optimization."""
12        if self.controller_type == SMCType.CLASSICAL:
13            # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, K, kd]
14            return [(0.1, 50.0)] * 4 + [(1.0, 200.0)] + [(0.0, 50.0)]
15        elif self.controller_type == SMCType.ADAPTIVE:
16            # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, gamma]
17            return [(0.1, 50.0)] * 4 + [(0.01, 10.0)]
18        elif self.controller_type == SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING:
19            # [K1, K2, k1, k2, lam1, lam2]
20            return [(1.0, 100.0)] * 2 + [(0.1, 50.0)] * 4
21        elif self.controller_type == SMCType.HYBRID:
22            # [c1, lambda1, c2, lambda2]
23            return [(0.1, 50.0)] * 4
24        else:
25            raise ValueError(f"Unknown SMC type: {self.controller_type}")

SMCFactoryÂ¶

Clean, focused factory for creating SMC controllers.

Optimized for:

  • PSO parameter optimization

  • Research benchmarking

  • Type safety and consistency

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class SMCFactory:
  2    """
  3    Clean, focused factory for creating SMC controllers.
  4
  5    Optimized for:
  6    - PSO parameter optimization
  7    - Research benchmarking
  8    - Type safety and consistency
  9    """
 10
 11    @staticmethod
 12    def create_controller(
 13        smc_type: Union[SMCType, str],
 14        config: SMCConfig
 15    ) -> SMCProtocol:
 16        """
 17        Create an SMC controller with clean, validated configuration.
 18
 19        Args:
 20            smc_type: Type of SMC controller to create
 21            config: Validated SMC configuration
 22
 23        Returns:
 24            Initialized SMC controller
 25
 26        Raises:
 27            ValueError: If controller type is invalid or configuration is invalid
 28        """
 29        # Normalize SMC type
 30        if isinstance(smc_type, str):
 31            try:
 32                smc_type = SMCType(smc_type.lower().replace("-", "_"))
 33            except ValueError:
 34                raise ValueError(f"Invalid SMC type: {smc_type}")
 35
 36        # Validate gains for this controller type
 37        spec = SMC_GAIN_SPECS[smc_type]
 38        if len(config.gains) < spec.n_gains:
 39            raise ValueError(
 40                f"{smc_type.value} requires at least {spec.n_gains} gains, got {len(config.gains)}"
 41            )
 42
 43        # Create controller based on type
 44        if smc_type == SMCType.CLASSICAL:
 45            return SMCFactory._create_classical_smc(config)
 46        elif smc_type == SMCType.ADAPTIVE:
 47            return SMCFactory._create_adaptive_smc(config)
 48        elif smc_type == SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING:
 49            return SMCFactory._create_super_twisting_smc(config)
 50        elif smc_type == SMCType.HYBRID:
 51            return SMCFactory._create_hybrid_smc(config)
 52        else:
 53            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported SMC type: {smc_type}")
 54
 55    @staticmethod
 56    def create_from_gains(
 57        smc_type: Union[SMCType, str],
 58        gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
 59        **kwargs: Any
 60    ) -> SMCProtocol:
 61        """
 62        PSO-friendly: Create controller directly from gains array.
 63
 64        Args:
 65            smc_type: Type of SMC controller
 66            gains: Gain values as list or array
 67            **kwargs: Additional configuration parameters
 68
 69        Returns:
 70            Initialized SMC controller
 71        """
 72        # Convert gains to list
 73        gains_list = list(np.asarray(gains).flatten())
 74
 75        # Create configuration with gains and defaults
 76        config = SMCConfig(gains=gains_list, **kwargs)
 77
 78        return SMCFactory.create_controller(smc_type, config)
 79
 80    @staticmethod
 81    def get_gain_specification(smc_type: Union[SMCType, str]) -> SMCGainSpec:
 82        """Get gain specification for an SMC controller type."""
 83        if isinstance(smc_type, str):
 84            smc_type = SMCType(smc_type.lower().replace("-", "_"))
 85        return SMC_GAIN_SPECS[smc_type]
 86
 87    @staticmethod
 88    def list_available_controllers() -> List[SMCType]:
 89        """List all available SMC controller types."""
 90        return list(SMCType)
 91
 92    # ========================================================================

103            dynamics_model=config.dynamics_model

109        return AdaptiveSMC(

113            leak_rate=config.leak_rate,
114            adapt_rate_limit=config.adapt_rate_limit,

122        )

FunctionsÂ¶

create_smc_for_pso(smc_type, gains, dynamics_model_or_max_force, dt, dynamics_model)Â¶

Convenience function optimized for PSO parameter tuning.

Supports both calling patterns:

  1. create_smc_for_pso(smc_type, gains, max_force, dt, dynamics_model)

  2. create_smc_for_pso(smc_type, gains, dynamics_model)

Usage: # In PSO fitness function controller = create_smc_for_pso(â€œclassical_smcâ€, pso_params) performance = evaluate_controller(controller, test_scenarios) return performance

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def create_smc_for_pso(
 2    smc_type: Union[SMCType, str],
 3    gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray],
 4    dynamics_model_or_max_force: Union[Any, float] = 100.0,
 5    dt: float = 0.01,
 6    dynamics_model: Optional[Any] = None
 7) -> PSOControllerWrapper:
 8    """
 9    Convenience function optimized for PSO parameter tuning.
10
11    Supports both calling patterns:
12    1. create_smc_for_pso(smc_type, gains, max_force, dt, dynamics_model)
13    2. create_smc_for_pso(smc_type, gains, dynamics_model)
14
15    Usage:
16        # In PSO fitness function
17        controller = create_smc_for_pso("classical_smc", pso_params)
18        performance = evaluate_controller(controller, test_scenarios)
19        return performance
20    """
21    # Handle different calling patterns
22    if isinstance(dynamics_model_or_max_force, (int, float)):
23        # Pattern 1: max_force provided as third argument
24        max_force = float(dynamics_model_or_max_force)
25        final_dynamics_model = dynamics_model
26    else:
27        # Pattern 2: dynamics_model provided as third argument
28        max_force = 100.0  # Use default
29        final_dynamics_model = dynamics_model_or_max_force
30
31    controller = SMCFactory.create_from_gains(
32        smc_type=smc_type,
33        gains=gains,
34        max_force=max_force,
35        dt=dt,
36        dynamics_model=final_dynamics_model
37    )
38
39    # Wrap controller for PSO-friendly interface
40    wrapper = PSOControllerWrapper(controller)
41
42    # Add PSO-required attributes to the wrapper
43    spec = SMCFactory.get_gain_specification(smc_type)
44    wrapper.n_gains = spec.n_gains
45    wrapper.controller_type = smc_type.value if isinstance(smc_type, SMCType) else str(smc_type)
46
47    return wrapper

get_gain_bounds_for_pso(smc_type)Â¶

Get PSO optimization bounds for SMC controller gains.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def get_gain_bounds_for_pso(smc_type: Union[SMCType, str]) -> tuple[List[float], List[float]]:
 2    """Get PSO optimization bounds for SMC controller gains."""
 3    spec = SMCFactory.get_gain_specification(smc_type)
 4    bounds = spec.gain_bounds
 5
 6    # Convert to PSO format: (lower_bounds, upper_bounds)
 7    lower_bounds = [bound[0] for bound in bounds]
 8    upper_bounds = [bound[1] for bound in bounds]
 9
10    return (lower_bounds, upper_bounds)

validate_smc_gains(smc_type, gains)Â¶

Validate that gains are appropriate for the SMC controller type.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def validate_smc_gains(smc_type: Union[SMCType, str], gains: Union[List[float], np.ndarray]) -> bool:
 2    """Validate that gains are appropriate for the SMC controller type."""
 3    try:
 4        spec = SMCFactory.get_gain_specification(smc_type)
 5        gains_array = np.asarray(gains)
 6
 7        # Check length
 8        if len(gains_array) < spec.n_gains:
 9            return False
10
11        # Check positivity for surface gains (SMC stability requirement)
12        if smc_type in [SMCType.CLASSICAL, SMCType.ADAPTIVE, SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING]:
13            if any(g <= 0 for g in gains_array[:4]):  # First 4 are typically surface gains
14                return False
15        elif smc_type == SMCType.HYBRID:
16            if any(g <= 0 for g in gains_array[:4]):  # All 4 gains must be positive
17                return False
18
19        return True
20    except Exception:
21        return False
